unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Dental Health and Probability
question_text:
According to a 2013 report by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, $83\%$ of children between the ages of $2$ and $17$ had a dental visit in the previous year. Assume this percentage has not changed.
What is the probability that in a random sample of $4$ children between the ages of $2$ and $17$, all of them would have had a dental visit in the previous year?
